duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate treatment pathways and set appropriate treatment plans for injured worker's health and return-to-work needs.
Implement criteria for identifying individuals for case management services and document case management plans.
Conduct assessment of injured worker/employee including health status, treatment plan, financial resources, and psychosocial status.
Manage disability duration and focus on return-to-work opportunities or other productive activity.
Collaborate and communicate with injured worker/employee, family members, providers, employer, and other involved parties.
Identify, evaluate, and recommend strategies for claims where vocational rehabilitation services may produce an eventual return-to-work.
Understand and implement criteria for discharge of injured worker/employee or termination of case management services.
Promote goodwill by assisting all involved parties on issues related to the injured worker/employee, provider relations, and coordination.
Proactively seek opportunities to increase knowledge, skills, and abilities in the field.
Perform other duties as needed to meet the needs of the business.

education_certification.credential: Bachelors in Science Nursing or Associate in Nursing (ASN) or Nursing Diploma.
Active RN license in the state of residence. National certification in case management or related field preferred.
3+ years of clinical experience as a Registered Nurse.
2+ years experience in medical case management, discharge planning, utilization review/management, occupational health, or comparable field.
Experience in Behavioral Health, Chronic Medical Conditions, or Oncology preferred.
Understanding of nationally recognized standards of the case management process.
Experience with Federal Employee Compensation Act (FECA) and FECA related issues preferable.
Effective team member with ownership mindset and embracement of change.
